spell.name: Purge Contamination

m.text: 100 gp of alchemical fluids or holy water, which the spell consumes

entries: You apply alchemical fluids or holy water to a Contaminated Humanoid creature while reciting an exacting magical chant which expels eldritch contaminants from its body. When you finish casting the spell, all {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} levels and mutations are removed from the creature. It then gains 1 level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} for each {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level removed with this spell.

item.name: Amulet of Incineration
entries: Crafted from a gem made from the elemental dust of an entropic flame set within a bone talisman, and glazed in the blood of an aberration, this amulet shimmers with an internal, ever-burning fire.

Once per turn, when you cast a spell that deals Fire damage using a spell slot, you can choose one target that was dealt Fire damage by the spell to gain the {@condition Burning|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} ({@dice 3d6} Fire) condition.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating an Amulet of Incineration requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Animus from an Elemental

items.name: [Bones]
entries: Spine from a Monstrosity

items.name: [Dust]
entries: Elemental Dust from an {@creature Entropic Flame|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Monster Blood from an Aberration

item.name: Amulet of Primal Wisdom
entries: Crafted from the dried leaves of magical plants and imbued with their dust, this amulet is decorated with a singular dried flower and then encased in sap. The pendant glows softly with the light of springtime and smells of floral fields in bloom.
Your Wisdom score is 19 while you wear this magic amulet. It has no effect on you if your Wisdom is 19 or higher without it.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating an Amulet of Primal Wisdom requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Plant Animus

items.name: [Dust]
entries: Plant Dust

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Sap

items.name: [Hair]
entries: Leaves

items.name: [Organ]
entries: Flower

item.name: Aqua Delerium
entries: This purple potion glows dimly with octarine light. It swirls and sparkles in its small, stoppered bottle.

When you drink this potion, you regain expended spell slots. Roll {@dice 1d6}. You choose spell slots to regain which have a combined level equal to or less than the result. None of the slots can be higher than level 5.
For one hour after drinking Aqua Delerium, roll {@dice 1d20} each time you cast a spell of level 1 or higher. On a 1, you trigger a random {@table Arcane Anomalies|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}.

If you consume more than one dose of Aqua Delerium before finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you take {@damage 1d12} Necrotic damage for each spell slot level regained from the second dose, and your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way.
When a creature who cannot cast spells using spell slots drinks Aqua Delerium, it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage and gains one level of {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating Aqua Delerium requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Any Animus

items.name: [Dust]
entries: Aberrant Dust

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Contaminated Ichor

items.name: [Organ]
entries: Any Glands

item.name: Aqua Expurgo
entries: This bright orange fluid is stored in a syringe and charged with arcane magic. You can use a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to administer the shot directly to the heart of yourself or another willing creature.

You are protected against {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} for six hours after receiving a dose of Aqua Expurgo. During this time, whenever you fail a saving throw against an effect which would cause you to gain one or more {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} levels, you can choose to succeed instead. You can use this ability three times, after which the effects of Aqua Expurgo expire.

If the effects of Aqua Expurgo expire in this manner, you immediately take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage and become {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} for 1 minute while you violently retch corrupt bile. Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You die if this effect reduces your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum to 0. The Necrotic damage can't be reduced or prevented by any means.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating Aqua Expurgo requires a Rare Workshop  and the following Rare Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Any Animus

items.name: [Dust]
entries: Aberrant Dust

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Contaminated Ichor

items.name: [Organ]
entries: Flower from a Plant (traditionally an Eldritch Lily)

item.name: Bracers of Arc Lightning
entries: These bracers are crafted with fine leathers decorated with magical scales, washed in elemental fluids, elemental dust, and contaminated ichor. The animus used must be from a creature that deals Lightning damage, allowing the bracers to channel the element.
While wearing these magic bracers you gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Lightning damage and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Shocked|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition.

These magic bracers have six charges, and regain all expended charges each day at dawn. Once per turn when you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack, you can expend one charge from the bracers to deal an extra {@damage 3d6} Lightning damage to the target. A target which takes this damage has the {@condition Shocked|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating Bracers of Arc Lightning requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Animus from a creature that deals Lightning damage (such as a Blue Dragon)

items.name: [Dust]
entries: Elemental Dust

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Elemental Fluid

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Contaminated Ichor

items.name: [Hide]
entries: Skin

items.name: [Hide]
entries: Scales

item.name: Charged Gauntlets
entries: These light gauntlets are made from cloth woven from the hair of a fiend and reinforced with the scales of a dragon. The gauntlets are washed with an alchemical formula made from elemental fluid and undead dust. They are then powered with a rare animus collected from an aberration.

Each time you hit with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} while attuned to these magic gauntlets they gain one charge. The gauntlets can have up to 10 charges. Any unexpended charges disappear when you take a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}.
While the gauntlets have at least one charge, your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} deal Lightning damage instead of its normal damage type.

While the gauntlets have 5 or more charges, your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} deal an additional {@damage 2d6} Lightning damage and push the target 10 feet away from you on a hit.
You can expend 2 charges from the gauntlets to cast the {@spell Shield|XPHB} spell.
You can expend 10 charges from the gauntlets to cast {@spell Destructive Wave|XPHB} or {@spell Wall of Force|XPHB}, using your monk's focus saving throw DC.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating Charged Gauntlets requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Aberrant Animus

items.name: [Dust]
entries: Undead Dust

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Elemental Fluid

items.name: [Hair]
entries: Hair from a Fiend

items.name: [Hide]
entries: Scales from a Blue or Bronze Dragon

item.name: Charm of Swarms
entries: This charm resembles a large gnat. It is made of the spores of dead mushrooms; the mandibles of an insectoid creature are placed upon it. The charm is coated in an acidic bile and held together by dried mucus. It smells of bugs and rot.

When an enemy within 5 feet of you scores a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on an attack made against you, you can cause the enemy to become {@condition Burning|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} ({@dice 2d6} Necrotic). While the target is {@condition Burning|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} in this way, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attacks against the target.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Charm of Swarms requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Any Animus

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Acidic Bile

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Mucus

items.name: [Natural Weapon]
entries: Spores

items.name: [Natural Weapon]
entries: Mandibles

item.name: Chip
entries: Delerium is a magical mineral left behind by the meteor that landed in Drakkenheim. It appears in geode clusters of translucent, sharp-edged crystals which reflect octarine light. The eldritch stones softly hum in dissonant tones, and glow brightly at night or when exposed to magic. Deposits are found throughout Drakkenheim, often fused into stone streets and buildings like crystalline moss.
A typical delerium fragment is about the size of a finger. Crystals may be fist-sized or slightly larger, and geodes may be as big as a pumpkin. Massive clusters might grow taller than a human.

entries.name: Delerium Properties
entries: All delerium samples have the following traits regardless of size:

items: {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage; as well as Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage from non-magical weapons.
{@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistant} to Acid, Cold, Fire, and Lightning damage; as well as Slashing and Piercing damage from magical weapons.
{@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|Vulnerable} to Bludgeoning damage from magical weapons.

Unless contained within an {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB}, delerium shatters and crumbles into worthless ash when reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. However, delerium geodes release a random {@table Arcane Anomalies|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} when destroyed.

entries.name: Delerium Hazards
entries: When a humanoid creature touches delerium without protective gear for the first time on their turn, or ends their turn in bodily contact with delerium, they must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage and gain one level of {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}.

entries.name: Delerium Harvesting
entries: Delerium found in Drakkenheim is usually fused into the ground or stone buildings. It is carefully extracted using handheld mining equipment such as shovels, picks, hammers, and chisels. Consult the table to determine how long it takes characters to extract delerium. Lacking proper equipment, extraction takes ten times as long. Massive clusters are impossible to extract without heavy equipment or powerful magic.

entries.name: Uses for Delerium
entries: Delerium has vast arcane potential. Beyond trade, crystals are used for several purposes:

entries.name: Spell Component
entries: Delerium may be used as an {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB} or material component for any spell on the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list. When casting a spell which requires a costly material component, a spellcaster may instead use delerium of equivalent or greater value to the required cost.

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: Delerium is an exceptional material for creating magical items of all kinds. Any existing magic item described in the Basic Rules could be made with delerium. Fragments, shards, crystals, and geodes may be used to make uncommon, rare, very rare, and legendary items respectively. At the GM's discretion, characters who can cast level 5 spells or higher may learn techniques to craft magic items of their own during their downtime.

entries.name: Stable Delerium
entries: The process for crafting magic items with delerium renders the crystals stable. Unless otherwise specified, characters do not take damage nor risk {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} when they touch or handle stable delerium. Stable delerium is damaged and destroyed in the same manner as a normal magic item of its kind.

entries.name: Delerium Dust
entries: Delerium dust is made by grinding the crystals against one another to create a fine powder. This milling process is extraordinarily hazardous unless performed within an {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB}. Delerium dust can be used in alchemy, as a spell component, a reagent for brewing potions, or mixed into inks used to scribe spell scrolls. {@variantrule Improvised Weapons|XPHB} & Ammunition. Delerium fragments may be used as ammunition for a {@item Sling|XPHB} or fashioned into a makeshift {@item Club|XPHB}. Such weapons and ammunition deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage, and humanoid creatures struck must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}. Delerium used as ammunition in this way is destroyed.

item.name: Circlet of Valor
entries: This steel circlet is forged from a construct and set with a gemstone animus containing a fiend. After being cleansed in the fires of a dragon's breath, this holy circlet glimmers with radiant energy.
When you cast a spell of level 1 or higher that restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to a creature, that creature gains Valor ({@dice 1d4}) until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Circlet of Valor requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Animus from a Fiend

items.name: [Dust]
entries: Any Dust

items.name: [Hide]
entries: Plates from a Construct

items.name: [Organ]
entries: Glands from a Dragon

item.name: Cold Snap Circlet
entries: This icy circlet is made from {@condition frozen|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} contaminated ichor, kept in a state of permafrost by the heart of a naturally cold creature, and lined with {@condition frozen|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} bones of undead, all powered by the animus of an elemental. Even in its permanently {@condition frozen|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} state, it is comfortable to wear.

Once per turn, when you cast a spell that deals Cold damage using a spell slot, you can choose one target that was dealt Cold damage by the spell to gain the {@condition Frozen|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition. The escape DC equals your spell save DC.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Cold Snap Circlet requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Animus from an Elemental

items.name: [Bones]
entries: Ribs from an Undead

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Contaminated Ichor

items.name: [Organ]
entries: Heart from a White Dragon, Silver Dragon, Winter Troll, or any monster {@variantrule Immune|XPHB} to Cold damage.

item.name: Crest of the Sacred Flame
entries: This crest is crafted from the compressed dust of fiends destroyed and sanctified by the Sacred Flame and torched in fires ignited by the elemental fluid taken from a dragon. This simple crest is made from the bones of undead creatures washed in acidic monster bile.
While attuned to this magic crest you increase the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of your Aura of Protection by 10 feet.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Crest of the Sacred Flame requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Any Animus

items.name: [Bones]
entries: Spine or Ribs

items.name: [Dust]
entries: Fiend Dust

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Acidic Bile

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Elemental Fluid

item.name: Electric Charge Ring
entries: This ring, composed of living lightning, is forged from elemental dust compressed into a gem around the lens eye of a construct, washed in the acidic glands of a monster before being set into an animus of an elemental.

items.name: [Animus]

entries: Eye from a Construct

items.name: [Organ]
entries: Glands

item.name: Everhot Stew Pot
entries: This cauldron is made using the plated iron from a construct infused with the ash of an elemental. The animus used must be from a dragon which adds both control and potency to the latent elemental magics. The spoon used to stir the cauldron is carved from the bone of a magical creature. This cauldron can heat to boiling temperatures without requiring fire simply by being filled and stirred, and the stews and soups it produces are always delicious and hearty.

During a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can cook enough stew to feed up to three creatures. All creatures who eat a stew from this pot gain 10 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. While a creature has these {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, they gain {@condition Valor|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} ({@dice 1d4}).

entries: Creating an Everhot Stew Pot requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Animus from a Dragon

items.name: [Bones]
entries: Ribs from a Monstrosity

items.name: [Dust]
entries: Elemental Dust

items.name: [Hide]
entries: Plates

item.name: Familiar Figurine
entries: Once per day as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can use this finely-carved figurine to cast {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB}.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Familiar Figurine requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Any

items.name: [Bones]
entries: Bones from a Giant

items.name: [Dust]
entries: Dust from an Elemental or Fey

item.name: Fractal Key
entries: As an action, a creature in a Thin Place can create a gate to the Ethereal Plane for 1 minute, after which the key crumbles to dust

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating the Fractal Key requires a Rare forge and the following components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Animus from a {@creature Fractal Lepidoptera|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}

items.name: [Bones]
entries: Bones of any Rare creature

Stable delerium is damaged and destroyed in the same manner as a normal magic item of its kind.

entries.name: Delerium Dust
entries: Delerium dust is made by grinding the crystals against one another to create a fine powder. This milling process is extraordinarily hazardous unless performed within an {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB}. Delerium dust can be used in alchemy, as a spell component, a reagent for brewing potions, or mixed into inks used to scribe spell scrolls. {@variantrule Improvised Weapons|XPHB} & Ammunition. Delerium fragments may be used as ammunition for a {@item Sling|XPHB} or fashioned into a makeshift {@item Club|XPHB}. Such weapons and ammunition deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage, and humanoid creatures struck must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}. Delerium used as ammunition in this way is destroyed.

item.name: Ghost Sight Bow
entries: This bow is hand-carved carefully from the bones of a dryad and stained in the undead blood of vampires. Strung with the hair of a banshee with a powerful wraith animus is placed within the handle. Once the bow's crafting is complete, it fades from its physical form into a semi-corporeal form.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic longbow.
The bow produces its own spectral ammunition which deals Force damage instead of Piercing damage. The ammunition disappears when it hits or misses a target.

While attuned to this weapon, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to see into the Ethereal Plane and see all {@condition invisible} creatures and objects until the end of your turn. Additionally, you can see through all walls and solid objects within 60 feet of you until the end of your turn. During this time, ammunition fired from this bow passes through solid objects, and you can target enemies within 60 feet of you with your ranged attacks, even if they are behind total cover. You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} only if you haven't moved during your turn. After you use the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} becomes 0 until the end of your turn.

item.name: Giant Femur Club
entries: This club is made from the cleaned and polished femur of a giant, crafted finely into a usable two-handed club. Its tapered hilt is wrapped in stained leather. Fastened to the top of the club is a large troll skull with several monstrous teeth embedded into it like a bone morningstar, giving the weapon a grim appearance. The club is imbued with elemental power from the animus used to power the weapon, which causes it to crackle with elemental power.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic greatclub, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls made against Giants.
While attuned to this club you deal an additional {@damage 2d6} damage of the type associated with the elemental dust infused into it.

entries: Your Dexterity score is 19 while you wear these ratling hide gloves. They have no effect on you if your Dexterity is 19 or higher without them.

item.name: Hazewind Cape
entries: This crimson and gold hooded cape is fitted with the feathers of fallen Harpies and dyed in their blood, this grants the wearer some resistance to the songs of Harpies. The cape is then infused with the dust of a fey creature which grants it a powerful anti-charm effect powered by an animus.
While wearing this cape, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

While your Rage is active, you gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage. In addition, once per turn, while you are Raging, when you hit a target with a Melee weapon that benefitted from your Reckless Attack feature, the target becomes {@condition Burning|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} ({@dice 2d4} Fire).

entries: Filled with diagrams showing humans with alien features, this book of strange medical lore is written in monster-blood ink infused with draconic dust and then etched onto parchment pages made from aberration skin. The manuscript is bound in a scale-clad cover.

You can use this manual as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Apothecary or Warlock spells. When you use the manual as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs of your Apothecary or Warlock spells.

In addition, the book contains the knowledge of an Apothecary Esoteric Theory or Warlock Eldritch Invocation up to a level determined by the manual's rarity and chosen when the item is created, which you gain while you are attuned to it. item.name: Mask of Monstrous Forms
entries: This magic mask is made from the skull of a particular monstrosity (with a {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} of 6 or lower). The skull is carved into a mask, engraved with aberrant dust, and then boiled in a vat of mimic mucus, the flesh of a doppelganger, and acidic bile. Finally, a vessel containing the animus of any creature with the Shapechanger trait is placed upon the forehead of the mask, channeling its shapechanging magic.
While attuned to the mask, you can expend two uses of your Wild Shape feature to transform into the monstrosity associated with the mask, instead of a Beast.

item.name: Massive Cluster
entries: Delerium is a magical mineral left behind by the meteor that landed in Drakkenheim. It appears in geode clusters of translucent, sharp-edged crystals which reflect octarine light. The eldritch stones softly hum in dissonant tones, and glow brightly at night or when exposed to magic. Deposits are found throughout Drakkenheim, often fused into stone streets and buildings like crystalline moss.
A typical delerium fragment is about the size of a finger. Crystals may be fist-sized or slightly larger, and geodes may be as big as a pumpkin. Massive clusters might grow taller than a human.

entries.name: Delerium Properties
entries: All delerium samples have the following traits regardless of size:

items: {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage; as well as Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage from non-magical weapons.
{@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistant} to Acid, Cold, Fire, and Lightning damage; as well as Slashing and Piercing damage from magical weapons.
{@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|Vulnerable} to Bludgeoning damage from magical weapons.

Unless contained within an {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB}, delerium shatters and crumbles into worthless ash when reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. However, delerium geodes release a random {@table Arcane Anomalies|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} when destroyed.

entries.name: Delerium Hazards
entries: When a humanoid creature touches delerium without protective gear for the first time on their turn, or ends their turn in bodily contact with delerium, they must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage and gain one level of {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}.

entries.name: Delerium Harvesting
entries: Delerium found in Drakkenheim is usually fused into the ground or stone buildings. It is carefully extracted using handheld mining equipment such as shovels, picks, hammers, and chisels. Consult the table to determine how long it takes characters to extract delerium. Lacking proper equipment, extraction takes ten times as long. Massive clusters are impossible to extract without heavy equipment or powerful magic.

entries.name: Uses for Delerium
entries: Delerium has vast arcane potential. Beyond trade, crystals are used for several purposes:

entries.name: Spell Component
entries: Delerium may be used as an {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB} or material component for any spell on the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list. When casting a spell which requires a costly material component, a spellcaster may instead use delerium of equivalent or greater value to the required cost.

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: Delerium is an exceptional material for creating magical items of all kinds. Any existing magic item described in the Basic Rules could be made with delerium. Fragments, shards, crystals, and geodes may be used to make uncommon, rare, very rare, and legendary items respectively. At the GM's discretion, characters who can cast level 5 spells or higher may learn techniques to craft magic items of their own during their downtime.

entries.name: Stable Delerium
entries: The process for crafting magic items with delerium renders the crystals stable. Unless otherwise specified, characters do not take damage nor risk {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} when they touch or handle stable delerium. Stable delerium is damaged and destroyed in the same manner as a normal magic item of its kind.

entries.name: Delerium Dust
entries: Delerium dust is made by grinding the crystals against one another to create a fine powder. This milling process is extraordinarily hazardous unless performed within an {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB}. Delerium dust can be used in alchemy, as a spell component, a reagent for brewing potions, or mixed into inks used to scribe spell scrolls. {@variantrule Improvised Weapons|XPHB} & Ammunition. Delerium fragments may be used as ammunition for a {@item Sling|XPHB} or fashioned into a makeshift {@item Club|XPHB}. Such weapons and ammunition deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage, and humanoid creatures struck must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}. Delerium used as ammunition in this way is destroyed.

item.name: Pelt of the Pack Lord
entries: This pelt cape is made from the fur of a Garmyr stitched carefully into the leathers of a ratling, decorated with the talons of a harpy, and polished to a shine with contaminated ichor.
While you are attuned to this pelt and are within 5 feet of a hostile creature, your allies have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against that creature.

entries.name: Crafting

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Contaminated Ichor

item.name: Pendant of Prismatic Protection
entries: The jeweled pendant has 3 charges, which are replenished when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. When you take Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison damage, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend 1 charge from the pendant to gain resistance to that damage type until the end of your next turn.

entries: Creating a Pendant of Prismatic Protection requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Any Animus from an Elemental

items.name: [Dust]
entries: Elemental Dust

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Any two Elemental Fluids from different Elementals

item.name: Potion of Controlled Mutation
entries: This sickly-looking potion contains a writhing mass of tentacles that animate and uncomfortably crawl down the imbiber's throat when consumed. The taste is pungent and fishy, and results in the sudden outbreak of random, but temporary, mutations.

When you consume this potion, you gain the effects of one randomly determined Mutation until you start a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can roll on the {@table Mutations|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} table twice, choosing which mutation manifests. You don't gain any {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} levels as a result of this Mutation. When the effect ends, your body returns to normal.

entries: Creating a Potion of Controlled Mutation requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

items.name: [Animus]
entries: Animus from an Aberration

items.name: [Fluid]
entries: Contaminated Ichor

items.name: [Organs]
entries: Any two Organs from an Aberration

item.name: Rat Tooth Dagger
entries: When you hit with an attack as part of an {@action Attack|XPHB} action using this magic dagger and apply your Sneak Attack to the damage roll, you can make an additional attack using this dagger as part of the same action. If that attack hits and meets the criteria for your Sneak Attack, you can apply half your Sneak Attack dice (rounded down) to the attack's damage.

items.name: [Animus]

items.name: [Fluid]

items.name: [Hide]
entries: Bark

entries: Claws from a Ratling

item.name: Reflector Shield
entries: This magic shield is formed from the shell of an Anomollusk combined with leather from an aberration as its handle. It's fused together and coated in contaminated ichor and inset with a rare animus. Once complete, the shell gives off an otherworldly hue that shimmers in kaleidoscopic patterns. The shield can reflect attacks and magic.

When you take Acid, Cold, Fire, Force, Lightning, or Thunder damage from a creature you can see within 60 feet of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cause the creature to take the same damage (you still take the damage).

After you consume a Rejuvenation Potion, you can't benefit from consuming another until you finish a {@dice 1d4} Long Rests.

item.name: Retracer Boots
entries: These boots are crafted from the flesh and scales of a dragon and decorated with Harpy feathers and the webbed membranes of flying creatures. The soles are injected with goopy ooze, allowing their wearer to jump back in time and space.

You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn to click the heels of these boots together. When you do, you teleport to the space you occupied at the start of your turn so long as it is currently unoccupied.

item.name: Scroll of Spell Power
entries: When you roll damage for a spell of level 1 or higher, you can expend this scroll to re-roll a number of the damage dice up to the level of the spell cast. You must use the new rolls.

items.name: [Animus]

item.name: Scythed Arm Blades
entries: These steel arm blades are razor sharp, 4-foot-long scythes that are fastened to two locking bracers made of spinal bones. The fasteners are made from fine leather with steel buckles. Delerium crystals are embedded in the armbands, infusing the blades with energy.
These magic shortswords function as a pair and must be wielded together for their magic properties to function. Attuning to the shortswords counts as being attuned to one magic item.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these magic shortswords. While attuned to these weapons, you can activate the Nick mastery property in addition to a different mastery property you're using with these weapons.

item.name: Talon Gloves
entries: These leather gloves are outfitted with the talons of fallen beasts and stitched together with the arcane stitching of apothecary creations. The gloves are then empowered by elemental magic, reinforced with bone, and powered by an animus.

While wearing these gloves, you gain {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} deal an additional {@damage 1d6} Piercing damage on a hit.

item.name: Tentacle Whip
entries: This whip is made from the tentacles and guts of aberrant creatures, stitched to the webbed membranes of winged beasts and fused to the bark of a plant creature. Once the animus is placed, the tentacles begin to writhe and wriggle and the whip can latch and drag creatures along the ground with uncanny strength.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic whip, which has a reach of 20 feet.
Once per turn when you hit a Large or smaller creature with an attack using this weapon, you can pull it 10 feet towards you.

item.name: Time Dilation Medallion
entries: The inner workings of this clockwork device are formed from gears forged from magical constructs gathered around a focusing lens, held together carefully by the needles of magical creatures. The animus used harnesses the energy of The Algorithm, a being of order and consequence, whose control over time and space ripples from the strange clockworks of the medallion.
This medallion has 3 charges. It crumbles to dust when you expend the final charge.

You can expend 1 charge from the medallion to take an extra action on your turn. Each time you do, you can roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 1, at the end of your turn, you become unstuck in time and space as the medallion casts the {@spell Maze|XPHB} spell on you. On a 6, the medallion regains {@dice 1d3} charges.

item.name: Trollblood Potion
entries: This potion is a bubbling, sickly, green-brown viscous soup that has the consistency of mucus. What appears to be the rotting eye of a troll floats in the potion. It smells acrid and nauseating and tastes even worse than it looks.
When you drink this potion, for the next minute, you regain 5 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of your turn. The effects of this potion end early if you take Fire or Acid damage.

item.name: Vampire Blood Potion
entries: This potion is a crimson-red bubbling brew that tastes distinctly of copper. When you drink this potion, you gain the following benefits for the next minute:

items: You gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength, Dexterity, and Charisma attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

If damage reduces you to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + half the damage taken, unless the damage is Radiant or from a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. On a success, you drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead, and the effects of this potion end.
The effects of this potion end early if you take Radiant damage or enter sunlight.

itemGroup.name: Manual of Occult Anatomy
entries: Filled with diagrams showing humans with alien features, this book of strange medical lore is written in monster-blood ink infused with draconic dust and then etched onto parchment pages made from aberration skin. The manuscript is bound in a scale-clad cover.

You can use this manual as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Apothecary or Warlock spells. When you use the manual as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs of your Apothecary or Warlock spells. The bonus is determined by the book's rarity (see the table below).

In addition, the book contains the knowledge of an Apothecary Esoteric Theory or Warlock Eldritch Invocation up to a level determined by the manual's rarity and chosen when the item is created, which you gain while you are attuned to it. This determines which class is required to attune to the item.

A blood-red ichor drips down this sword's darkened steel blade. The sword is coated in sanguine witch blood. The dust of dead vampires is forged into the steel of the blade, giving it its blackened sheen. The edge is then empowered by the heart of a dragon. Its gold hilt wrapped in crimson leathers and a bloodred ruby plucked from the corpse of a Sanguine Witch. The fangs of vampires decorate the pommel.
You gain a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic sword.

Any a creature you hit with this weapon that isn't a Construct or Undead takes an extra {@damage 3d6} Necrotic damage, and you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

This armor channels cold energy through carefully manufactured veins of elemental fluid that run along the inside of its frame. Elemental dust is mixed with the gold in its forming, and contaminated ichor is used as a catalyst to magnify the magical effects. The animus gem placed centrally upon it must be infused with the energy of a frost giant.
While attuned to this armor you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold damage and are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to the {@condition Frozen|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition.

This magical armor has six charges, and regains all expended charges each day at dawn. When you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and expend 1 charge from the armor to freeze your attacker in place. The creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition Frozen|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} (DC 15).

A hammer of chaos is crafted by melting down the magical plates of otherworldly constructs, infused with both the fluid and dust of elementals. The weapon is then soaked in the grey matter of an aberrant brain. This steel hammer is fitted into a shaft made from fiend skin leather and the ribs of a dragon.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this weapon. This hammer has {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} with a normal range of 30 feet and a long range of 90 feet. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder. The hammer deals {@damage 2d8} extra damage of the chosen type.

When you hit with a ranged attack using this weapon, if you roll the same number on two or more of the d8s, the hammer ricochets to a different target of your choice within 30 feet of the target. Make an attack roll against the new target, and make a new damage roll if the attack hits. After making this attack, the hammer flies back to your hand.

When played, this instrument reverberates with draconic whispers and enchantment that drift subtly within the notes that are struck, giving the music a sense of foreboding and palpable charm. Crafted from finely polished ivory and imbued with the animus of a fey creature, the true magic of this harp comes from the finely crafted strings made from combining the sinew of a dragon's heart chords and the hair of a fey, willingly given out of kindness.
You can use this magical harp as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Bard spells. While attuned to this item, you gain a +1 bonus to your spell attack rolls and spell save DC.

When you cast an Enchantment spell of level 1 to level 5 that targets only one creature using this harp as the {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}, you can target a second creature within the spell's range.

This crossbow is covered in metal plating, decorative and refined pointed metal tips along an oak wood body, and foregrip. The barrel and limb are reinforced with the steel plates from a construct, with a stained leather grip made from a monster's hide. Its hair strung bowstring and leather fasteners hold a series of syringes in place. The crossbow's stock has a series of various tubes extruding from it that connect to an alchemical chamber on the side of the weapon. A mechanical wheel feeds the darts into place upon filling them, auto-loading the crossbow for easy firing.

You gain a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic crossbow. This crossbow ignores {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading}, and you don't need a free hand to load a piece of ammunition into it.
Once per turn when you hit a creature with a ranged attack using this crossbow, you can apply one of the following poisons.

entries.name: Immobilizing

These weapons are carved from bark, with a core of magical sap, and decorated with leaves from magical plants. Their hilts and shafts are bound in hair from a fey creature. This magic weapon channels the natural magic found in the elements of nature.

While holding this magic weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Ranger spells. The bonus is determined by the weapon's rarity. In addition, you can use the weapon as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Ranger spells.

When you hit with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a Ranger spell slot to cast {@spell Hunter's Mark|XPHB} on the target as part of the same action used to make the attack. When you cast {@spell Hunter's Mark|XPHB} in this way it does not require {@status Concentration|XPHB}. Additionally, the spell lasts for one minute or until the target dies or you cast {@spell Hunter's Mark|XPHB} again using either the weapon or otherwise.

This suit of armor is constructed from the bones of the dead and outfitted over black woven fabric. The armor has two skulls as pauldrons upon the shoulders, a reinforced spine, and a rib cage that covers the front, and the entire structure is ornately decorated with the fangs of fallen beasts. The bones are magically imbued with otherworldly energy, powered by a powerful undead animus.
While attuned to this armor, you are proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with light armor.

While you are within 30 feet of an Undead creature under your control, you gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage except Radiant. However, each time you take damage, choose an Undead creature under your control within 30 feet of you. That creature takes the same amount of damage, which can't be reduced or prevented in any way.

This otherworldly blade is made from starmetal steel; a potent alloy produced by combining iron with carbon extracted from the bones of powerful aberrant creatures.  During the forging process, the blade is quenched in the spinal fluids of a {@creature Far Dweller|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} to draw out extraplanar forces. The resulting metal has an octarine sheen that reflects possible worlds and other realities. The grip and crossguard are decorated with the barbs and leather of a {@creature Warp Marauder|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}, and the pommel is set with a {@item crystal|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|delerium crystal} containing the eldritch essence of a {@creature Far Dweller|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} that powers the weapon's magic.
You gain a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls made using this magic weapon.

Once per turn when you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} or reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} using this weapon, immediately after the attack you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 120 feet you can see. Additionally, once per turn when you teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of another creature while wielding this weapon, you can make one weapon attack against that creature with this weapon as part of the same action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} made to teleport.

While holding the blade, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast {@spell Dimension Door|XPHB}. Once you do, you must finish a short or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can use this feature again.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The host casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to spell attacks):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The host makes two Mind Spike attacks.

action.name: Mind Spike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) Psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Barrage {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 17}, up to three creatures the host can see within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} 28 ({@damage 8d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Jinxed|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition ({@dice 1d8}; save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

reaction.name: Thought Shield
entries: {@actTrigger} The host or a creature it can see fails a saving throw or is hit by an attack. {@actResponse} The target rolls {@dice 1d6} and adds the result to its AC or saving throw, potentially turning a hit into a miss or a failure into a success.

action.name: Force Dart
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) Force damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to spell attacks):

trait.name: Academy Rings (1/Day)
entries: The mage can cast a spell from Spellcasting without expending a use of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mage makes four Prismatic Blast attacks.

action.name: Prismatic Blast
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 9}, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (mage's choice).

bonus.name: Misty Step {@recharge 5}
entries: The mage casts {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} using the spellcasting ability from Spellcasting.

reaction.name: Contingency (1/Day)
entries: {@actTrigger} The mage would become {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} from a spell. {@actResponse} The mage casts {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} (level 5 version) targeting itself.

entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 21}, each creature in a 120-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 72 ({@damage 16d8}) Necrotic damage, and the target gains one {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level. trait.name: Immutable Form

trait.name: Malignancy
entries: The Amalgamation can't be teleported or travel to another plane against its will.

trait.name: Rejuvenation

trait.name: Ultimate Corruption

However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Amalgamation takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 17}, reach 10 ft. {@h}36 ({@damage 4d12 + 10}) Force damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the Amalgamation, the grapple ends and the target is swallowed. While swallowed, the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions, has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} from effects originating from outside the Amalgamation, and takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) Necrotic damage and gains a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level at the start of each of the Amalgamation's turns.

If the Amalgamation takes 50+ damage in a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which land in spaces within 10 feet of the Amalgamation and have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. If the Amalgamation dies, a swallowed creature no longer has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and can escape the corpse using 15 feet of its movement, exiting with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 17}, reach 60 ft. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) Force damage, and the target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 25}). While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. The Amalgamation has twelve tentacles, each of which can grapple one target. Fling. One Large or smaller object held or creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the Amalgamation is thrown up to 60 feet, landing with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. If the target strikes a solid surface, it takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Force damage. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Mind-Breaking Whispers {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 25}, one creature within 120 feet of the Amalgamation. {@actSaveFail} The target becomes insane until it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. While insane, the target can't take actions, understand other creatures, read, or speak anything but gibberish. entries: Each creature within 120 feet of the Amalgamation with one or more {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} levels takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage and gains a randomly determined mutation.

A creature within 5 feet can take an action to clean away the goop, ending the {@condition Slowed|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition.

entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 18}, one creature the Apex can see within 120 feet. {@actSaveFail} 45 ({@damage 10d8}) Cold damage, and the target has the {@condition Frozen|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition ({@dc 18}). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

reaction.name: Rapid Adaptation
entries: {@actTrigger} The Apex takes damage that isn't Necrotic or Psychic. {@actResponse} The Apex gains {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to that damage type until it is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or finishes a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

monster.name: Arcane Wraith

resist.note: from Nonmagical Attacks that aren't Silvered

languages: The languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The arcane wraith casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The arcane wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The arcane wraith makes three Comet Shard attacks.

action.name: Comet Shard
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) Force damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from the arcane wraith.

action.name: Nightmare Pattern {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 14}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} centered on a point the arcane wraith can see. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition (save ends). While {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Immobilized|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition. The effect ends for the target if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it out of its nightmare. When the effect ends, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Psychic damage.

trait.name: Aura of Dread
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Vladimir von Drakken takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Daywalker
entries: Vladimir von Drakken doesn't possess any Vampire Weaknesses from the Monsters of Drakkenheim.

trait.name: Reborn Transformation
entries: When he finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, Vladimir von Drakken reverts to his Reborn Vladimir von Drakken form.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Vladimir von Drakken regains 30 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} remaining.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Vladimir von Drakken is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or dies, he drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead unless he is killed by a creature with the blood of House von Drakken within them.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Vladimir von Drakken can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Vladimir von Drakken always takes his turn on Initiative count 20
entries: On his turn, Vladimir von Drakken can use his movement and interaction as normal. However, he does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on his turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Vladimir von Drakken takes one of the following {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Epic Actions} at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Bloodmourne
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 5 ft. {@h}35 ({@damage 6d8 + 8}) Force damage, and the target has the {@condition Bleeding|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition ({@dice 4d4}).

items.name: Claws
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 5 ft. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) Necrotic damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 23}).

action.name: Bite (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 23}, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, or {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveFail} 70 ({@damage 20d6}) Necrotic damage, and the target has the {@condition Weakened|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition ({@dc 22} Constitution save ends). Vladimir von Drakken regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt. A Humanoid killed by this damage rises on its next turn as a Vampire Spawn under Vladimir von Drakken's control.

action.name: Soul Rending {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 23}, each creature in a 60-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 54 ({@damage 12d8}) Necrotic damage. Failure by 5 or More: Double damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

action.name: Terrifying Glare
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 23}, one creature Vladimir von Drakken can see within 120 feet. {@actSaveFail} 25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. Failure by 5 or More: While {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Wing Blast (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 23}, each creature in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from Vladimir von Drakken. {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from Vladimir von Drakken and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} Before or after using this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}, Vladimir von Drakken can move up to half his {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} action.

action.name: Aerial Maneuver (1/Round)
entries: Vladimir von Drakken moves up to his {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} action.

action.name: Epic Resistance
entries: Vladimir von Drakken chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on him. He can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.

reaction.name: Blood Rage (1/Day)
entries: {@actTrigger} Vladimir von Drakken becomes {@status Bloodied|XPHB}. He can use this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} even if he has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or is otherwise unable to take Reactions. {@actResponse} All conditions and spells on Vladimir von Drakken end unless he chooses to be affected by them, and he can move up to his {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} action and ignoring {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. Vladimir von Drakken recharges and immediately uses Soul Rending.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The beetle knight makes two Scything Arm-Blade attacks.

action.name: Scything Arm-Blade
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 10 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Pincer Horn
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 10 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Piercing damage, or 26 ({@damage 4d10 + 4}) Piercing damage if the beetle knight moved 20+ feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit. If the target is Medium or smaller, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 14}). While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and the beetle knight can't use its Pincer Horn against another target.

bonus.name: Fling
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 14}, one creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the beetle knight. {@actSaveFail} The target is thrown up to {@dice 1d6  10} feet, landing with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. If the target strikes a solid surface, it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

reaction.name: Carapace Parry
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature the beetle knight can see hits it with an attack. {@actResponse} The beetle knight adds 2 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The belfray doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} action when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The belfray has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The belfray makes two Claws attacks and one Bite attack. It can replace its Bite with Sonic Blast, if available.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 10 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) Piercing damage, and the target has the {@condition Enfeebled|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition until the end of the belfray's next turn. The belfray regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage dealt by its Bite.

action.name: Sonic Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 15}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the belfray that can hear it. {@actSaveFail} 22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) Thunder damage, and the target has the {@condition Weakened|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition (save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

bonus.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, the belfray takes the {@action Hide|XPHB} action.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Big Linda is destroyed and her corpse is left within an area of the Deep Haze for 1 hour, she is revived with all of her {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: When Big Linda starts her turn in an area of the Deep Haze, she regains 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Big Linda dies only if she starts her turn with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Big Linda makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 11}, reach 10 ft. {@h}33 ({@damage 4d12 + 7}) Piercing damage, and if the target is Medium or smaller, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 19}). While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and Big Linda can't Bite another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 11}, reach 10 ft. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Acid Spew {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 16}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 63 ({@damage 14d8}) Acid damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Bigger Linda is destroyed and her corpse is left within an area of the Deep Haze for 1 hour, she is revived with all of her {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: When Bigger Linda starts her turn in an area of the Deep Haze, she regains 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Bigger Linda dies only if she starts her turn with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Haze Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Bigger Linda is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave con} {@dc 22}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Bigger Linda deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: Bigger Linda has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to any spell or effect that would alter her form.

action.name: Bigger Linda always takes her turn on Initiative count 20
entries: On her turn, Bigger Linda can use her movement and interaction as normal. However, she does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on her turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Bigger Linda takes one of the following {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Epic Actions} at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 10 ft. {@h}35 ({@damage 4d12 + 9}) Piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 23}). While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and Bigger Linda can't Bite another target.

items.name: Tail
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 15 ft. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) Bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is pushed 20 feet away from Bigger Linda and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Stomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 5 ft. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 9}) Bludgeoning damage. {@actSave con} {@dc 23}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Staggered|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition (save ends).

action.name: Breathe Deep
entries: Bigger Linda's Breath Weapon recharges. Bigger Linda can only take this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} as the first {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} she uses this round. After using this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}, Bigger Linda can't take her Bite {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} until the start of the next round.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Special Recharge)
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 22}, each creature in a 60-foot long, 5-foot wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 31 ({@damage 7d8}) Necrotic damage plus 31 ({@damage 7d8}) Force damage, and the target gains a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

action.name: Trampling Rampage (Recharges When {@status Bloodied|XPHB})
entries: Bigger Linda moves up to her {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} in a straight line, moving through the space of Large or smaller creatures in her path. She makes one Stomp attack against each creature she moves through.

action.name: Teleport (1/Round)
entries: Bigger Linger teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see within the Deep Haze.

action.name: Epic Resistance
entries: Bigger Linda chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on her. Bigger Linda can use this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} even if she would otherwise be unable to take actions, her actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters her game statistics.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Blackjack Mel is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if he fails, provided he doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Knife
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) Piercing damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Blackjack Mel takes the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, or {@action Hide|XPHB} action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature Blackjack Mel can see deals damage to him with an attack. {@actResponse} Blackjack Mel halves the damage he takes from that attack.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dreg can breathe air and water.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Acid Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 11}, each creature in a 15-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 5 ({@damage 2d4}) Acid damage and is {@condition Burning|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} ({@dice 2d4} Acid).

trait.name: Insect Swarm
entries: The bloated hive emits a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of buzzing insects. A creature that starts its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Disrupt the Hive
entries: When the bloated hive dies, it immediately spawns a {@creature Swarm of Contaminated Insects|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} in its space.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Bloated Hive makes two attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Spawn Swarm {@recharge 5}
entries: The bloated hive creates a {@creature Swarm of Contaminated Insects|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}, which appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet. The swarm takes its turn immediately after the bloated hive.

bonus.name: Distracting Swarm
entries: The bloated hive causes its Insect Swarm to fly in the face of a creature within 5 feet of it. The target can't take Reactions until the end of the bloated hive's turn.

trait.name: Aquatic Camouflage
entries: The leech has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks made to hide in aquatic terrain.

trait.name: Blood Bags
entries: The leech has three blood bags in its body. When encountered, roll {@dice 1d3} to determine how many blood bags are filled with blood. The rest are empty.

action.name: Attach
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 0 ft. {@h}The leech attaches to the target. While attached, the leech doesn't attack, and moves with the target, using none of the leech's movement. The leech can detach itself using 5 feet of movement, and detaches immediately if its blood bags are filled or if the target dies.

A creature within 5 feet can take an action to detach the leech with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|XPHB}) check. {@actSaveFail} The leech is still detached, but the target has the {@condition Bleeding|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition ({@dice 2d4}). Failure by 5 or More: The leech isn't detached and the target takes 8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) Piercing damage.

bonus.name: Blood Drain
entries: The leech can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} only when it is attached to a creature. The attached creature loses 10 ({@dice 3d6}) {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} due to blood loss, and the blood leech fills one of its empty blood bags with some of the target's blood.

bonus.name: Blood Transfusion
entries: The leech can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} only when it is attached to a creature and has at least one filled blood bag. The attached creature regains 10 {@dice 3d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and the leech empties one of its filled blood bags.

monster.name: Body Snatcher
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Clinging Shadows
entries: A creature in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks to escape the body snatcher's grapple. Each time a creature attempts to escape the body snatcher's grapple while it is in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Necrotic damage. If this Necrotic damage reduces the target to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the target is stabilized but has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition for 1 hour, even if it regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries: The body snatcher takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Radiant damage if it ends its turn in sunlight, and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and ability checks while in sunlight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The body snatcher makes four Grabbing Hands attacks.

action.name: Grabbing Hands
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 10 ft. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) Bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the body snatcher can't use this hand against another target. The body snatcher has four hands, each of which can grapple one target.

bonus.name: Shadow Teleport
entries: The body snatcher teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see that is in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}. It can bring any Medium or smaller creature it is grappling, teleporting that creature to an unoccupied space it can see within 5 feet of its destination that is also in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}. An unwilling creature can make a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw to resist being teleported. On a successful save, neither the creature nor the body snatcher {@spell Teleport|XPHB}.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The bojack can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the bojack remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal animal corpse.

trait.name: Sudden Death
entries: Creatures that haven't yet taken a turn in combat are {@condition Helpless|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} against attacks made by the bojack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bojack makes two attacks, using Impaling Limbs or Corrosive Mucus in any combination.

action.name: Impaling Limbs
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) Piercing damage and the target is {@condition Bleeding|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} ({@dice 2d6}). While {@condition Bleeding|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} in this way, the target is also {@condition Slowed|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}.

action.name: Corrosive Mucus
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/60 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d4 + 4}) Acid damage and the target is {@condition Burning|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} ({@dice 2d4} Acid). While {@condition Burning|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} in this way, the target's AC becomes 10 + its Dexterity modifier.

bonus.name: Predatory Cunning
entries: The bojack takes the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, or {@action Hide|XPHB} action.

trait.name: Cacophonous Chorus
entries: The cacophonous chimera creates a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of noise. A creature that starts its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} that can hear it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Thunder damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The cacophonous chimera has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

action.name: The cacophonous chimera always takes its turn on Initiative count 20
entries: On its turn, the cacophonous chimera can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the cacophonous chimera takes one of the following {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Epic Actions} at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Claws and Talons
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 11}, reach 10 ft. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) Slashing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Contaminated Bite (1/Round)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 11}, reach 10 ft. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) Piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage. {@actSave con} {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.

action.name: Lamprey Tail
entries: Melee {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB}:+11, reach 30 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) Piercing damage, and the target has the {@condition Bleeding|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition ({@dice 2d4}).

action.name: Aerial Maneuver (1/Round)
entries: The cacophonous chimera flies up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} action.

action.name: Cacophony (1/Round)
entries: The cacophonous chimera's three heads sing a discordant song. The effect of the song varies based on which of the chimera's head is taking the lead. Each time the cacophonous chimera uses this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}, it can't use the same effect it chose last round.

action.name: Bewildering Chitter (Ratling)
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 300-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the chimera that can hear it. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Bewildered|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition (save ends).

action.name: Chilling Howl (Garmyr)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 300-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the cacophonous chimera that can hear it. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Cold damage, and the target has the {@condition Immobilized|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition (save ends).

action.name: Staggering Screech (Harpy)
entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 300-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the cacophonous chimera that can hear it. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage, and the target has the {@condition Staggered|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition (save ends).

action.name: Wing Blast
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 17}, each creature within 15 feet of the cacophonous chimera. {@actSaveFail} 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) Thunder damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from the chimera. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

action.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The cacophonous chimera chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The cacophonous chimera can use this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

reaction.name: Crescendo of Chaos (1/Day)
entries: {@actTrigger} The cacophonous chimera becomes {@status Bloodied|XPHB}. It can take this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} even if it has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or is otherwise unable to take Reactions. {@actResponse} All conditions and spells on the cacophonous chimera immediately end unless it chooses to be affected by them, and it can move up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} action and ignoring {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.

It then unleashes a blast of thunderous power. Creatures within 300 feet of it who can hear it are subjected to the following effect. {@actSave wis} {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} 17 ({@damage 5d6}) Thunder damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and can't stand until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Ansom is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails, provided he doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ansom makes four attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 7}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) Piercing damage, and the target has the {@condition Slowed|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition until the end of Ansom's next turn.

bonus.name: Flurry of Blades
entries: Ansom makes two Shortsword attacks.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature Ansom can see hits him with an attack. {@actResponse} Ansom adds 3 to his AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss.

monster.name: Cerebrograft
languages: telepathy 30 ft. The languages of its creator

trait.name: Dual Minds
entries: The cerebrograft has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Stunned|XPHB}, and {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} conditions.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cerebrograft makes two Slam attacks and uses Telekinetic Grip.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 5 ft. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Telekinetic Grip
entries: The cerebrograft reaches out with its mind to hold one creature or object it can see within 120 feet of it in its psychic grasp. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave str} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} The target is moved up to 30 feet in any direction and has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the start of the cerebrograft's next turn or until the cerebrograft has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is telekinetically moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The cerebrograft can also exert fine control on objects with its telekinesis, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

action.name: Psychic Crush {@recharge 5}
