entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 17}, reach 10 ft. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) Force damage, and the target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 25}). While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Whispers (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 25}. one creature the Whispered Promise can see within 300 feet. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Psychic damage, and the target is {@condition Dazed|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} (save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. Failure by five or more: Double damage, and the target is {@condition Stunned|XPHB} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Promises (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 25}, one creature the Whispered Promise can see within 300 feet. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Psychic damage, and the target is {@condition Jinxed|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} ({@dice 1d10}) (save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. Failure by 5 or more: Double damage, and the target becomes cursed. While cursed, the target can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and gains no benefits from taking a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

action.name: Unfettered Glide
entries: The Whispered Promise moves up to their {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} action.

action.name: Dominate (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 25}, one creature the Whispered Promise can see within 300 feet. {@actSaveFail} The creature has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, the target obeys the Whispered Promise's commands and can't take Reactions. Failure by 5 or More: The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition instead lasts for 24 hours or until the Whispered Promise is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Each time the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. {@actSaveSuccess} The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its next attack roll against the Whispered Promise.

action.name: Epic Resistances
entries: The Whispered Promise chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on them. The Whispered Promise can use this action even if they would otherwise be unable to take actions, their actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters their game statistics.

trait.name: Delerium Storm Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 120 feet of the World Ender takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Lightning damage and is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave con} {@dc 24}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains one {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The World Ender is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Mutations Abound
entries: A creature that gains a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level from the World Ender's Delerium Storm Aura must roll {@dice 2d6} and take the lower result to determine if they mutate. Whenever a creature within the aura gains a mutation, that creature must roll twice on the {@table Mutations|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} table and gains both mutations.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the World Ender is destroyed, it regains all of its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} in 1 hour unless a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell is used to prevent it from rejuvenating. This is a stressful use of the {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The World Ender deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Unbound Arcana
entries: Whenever the World Ender is the target of a spell, an {@table Arcane Anomalies|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} is triggered on the caster.

action.name: The World Ender always takes its turn on Initiative count 20
entries: On its turn, the World Ender can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the World Ender takes one of the following {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Epic Actions} at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Necrotic Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 19}, reach 15 ft. {@h}37 ({@damage 5d10 + 10}) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Bite (1/Round)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 19}, reach 15 ft. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d10 + 10}) Piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 27}). While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and the World Ender can't Bite another target.

action.name: Charge Eradication Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: Octarine energy ripples through the body of the World Ender from its tail up to its head. The World Ender's Eradication Beam recharges, and it chooses the direction it will face to unleash its Eradication Beam.

The World Ender can only use this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} if it's the first {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} it has taken this round. After using this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}, The World Ender can't use Bite, Bellowing Roar, or Devour until the start of the next round.

action.name: Eradication Beam (Special Recharge)
entries: The World Ender can only use this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} if it's the last {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} it takes this round. {@actSave con} {@dc 27}, each creature and object in a 1000-foot long, 20-foot wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 110 ({@damage 20d10}) Force damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} A creature is disintegrated along with anything it is wearing or carrying if this damage leaves it with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and can't be revived except by a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.

The Eradication Beam destroys any {@spell Wall of Force|XPHB}, {@spell Forcecage|XPHB}, or {@spell Prismatic Wall|XPHB} spell within its area. It also damages unattended magic items in its area, including artifacts.

action.name: Octarine Lightning Strike
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 27}, each creature in a 10-foot radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point within 500 feet. {@actSaveFail} 54 ({@damage 12d8}) Lightning damage, and the target has the {@condition Shocked|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition until the start of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

action.name: Bellowing Roar (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 27}, each creature in a 120-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the World Ender that can hear it. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition (save ends). While {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Ground Slam (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 27}, each creature on the ground in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 26 ({@damage 4d12}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from the World Ender and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} becomes {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} until the start of the World Ender's next turn.

action.name: Devour
entries: The World Ender can't take this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} if it has used its Bite {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} this round. The World ender makes a Bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it has {@condition Grappled|XPHB}. If the attack hits, the target takes the Bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions, it has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} against effects originating from outside the World Ender, and it takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) Acid damage and gains a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level at the start of each of the World Ender's turns.

If the World Ender takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the World Ender must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which land in unoccupied spaces within 10 feet of the World Ender with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. If the World Ender dies, a swallowed creature no longer has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The World Ender chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The World Ender can use this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics; 1/Round)
headerEntries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 26}):

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the Thing with the Writhing Tail is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks made to ascertain the being's intentions or sincerity have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

trait.name: Purring Aura
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail projects a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of madness and dread. A creature that ends its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 hour. A creature can take an action to attempt to overcome its fear, making a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw. {@actSaveFail} The target takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) Psychic damage. {@actSaveSuccess} The {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition ends for that creature, and it becomes immune to the Purring Aura of the Thing with the Writhing Tail for 24 hours.

trait.name: Quantum Displacement
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail shifts between realities and timelines. Attack rolls against it have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, and it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws. If it is hit by an attack or fails a saving throw, this trait is disrupted until it uses Phase Displacement. This trait is also disrupted while the Thing with the Writhing Tail has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 0.

action.name: The Thing with the Writhing Tail always takes its turn on Initiative count 20
entries: On its turn, The Thing with the Writhing Tail can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, The Thing with the Writhing Tail takes one of the following {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Epic Actions} at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Cosmic Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 10 ft. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) Force damage.

action.name: Tail Whip
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 26}, one creature the Thing with the Writhing Tail can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Dazed|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition (save ends). Failure by 5 or More: 70 ({@damage 20d6}) Psychic damage, and the target instead has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition (save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

action.name: Manifest Duplicate (1/Round)
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail creates a perfect visual illusion of itself in an unoccupied space it can see within 300 feet. The illusion is intangible and doesn't occupy its space. The duplicate lasts for 1 minute, but it ends early if the Thing with the Writhing Tail dismisses it (no action required) or has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. The Thing with the Writhing Tail can have a up to eight illusory duplicates at a time. While it has one or more duplicates, it has the following benefits:

action.name: Attacks and Spells
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail can cast spells, use Tail Whip, and make Claw attacks as if was in an illusory duplicate's space.

action.name: Aura Expansion
entries: Each illusory duplicate emanates a Purring Aura. The effects of multiple overlapping auras do not stack; a creature is only affected once by the Purring Aura even if it is within range of multiple Emanations.

action.name: Move
entries: Each time the Thing with the Writhing Tail takes this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}, it can move any number of illusions up to 60 feet to unoccupied spaces within 300 feet of itself.

action.name: Distract
entries: When both the Thing with the Writhing Tail and one of its illusory duplicates are within 10 feet of a creature that can see them, the Thing with the Writhing Tail has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against that creature.

action.name: Sense
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail can see and hear through each of its illusory duplicates.

action.name: Phase Displacement
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail teleports, swapping places with one of its illusory duplicates. If its Quantum Displacement trait was disrupted, it is no longer disrupted.

action.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting it and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The Thing with the Writhing Tail can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
entries: The Think Tank is immune to {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} and has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against contaminated spells. The Think Tank may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} levels.

trait.name: Life Support System
entries: The Think Tank is protected by three machine nodes that make up its Life Support System. The nodes are positioned in a triangle, each no further than 30 feet apart from the rest. Each node is a Large object with AC 20, 25 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} per player character, and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage. The Think Tank can't move or be moved more than 60 feet away from any two of its Life Support System nodes.

trait.name: Nightmare Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 120 feet of the Think Tank takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Psychic damage.

trait.name: Shield Generator
entries: As long as at least one machine node in the Life Support System remains, the Think Tank's {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immunities} can't be ignored except by effects caused by level 9 spells or artifacts. If all nodes are destroyed, the Think Tank loses its {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immunities}.

trait.name: Telepathic Eavesdropping
entries: The Think Tank can project its consciousness to see and hear any creature or location within 5 miles as if it had cast {@spell Scrying|XPHB} (no action required). It can read the thoughts of creatures in this area, communicate with them telepathically, and listen in on telepathic communications which occur between other creatures in the region. It remains aware of its own surroundings while doing so. It cannot observe the area within a Private Sanctum spell or locations and creatures protected by magic which blocks divination or scrying sensors.

action.name: The Think Tank always takes its turn on Initiative count 20
entries: On its turn, the Think Tank can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Think Tank takes one of the following {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Epic Actions} at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Contaminated Blast
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 12}, reach 10 ft., or range 120 ft. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) Necrotic damage. {@actSave con} {@dc 20}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.

items.name: Telekinetic Grip
entries: The Think Tank reaches out with its mind to hold one creature or object it can see within 120 feet of it in its psychic grasp. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave str} {@dc 20}. {@actSaveFail} 28 ({@damage 8d6}) Force damage, and the target is moved up to 30 feet in any direction and has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until it escapes or the Think Tank has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. The Think Tank can hold up to two creatures or objects in its grip at one time. On its turn, a held creature can take an action to repeat the save, escaping the grip on a success.

If the target is an object weighing 1,000 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is telekinetically moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The Think Tank can also exert fine control on objects with its telekinesis, such as manipulating surgical tools or opening a door or a container.

items.name: Pluck the Puppet Strings
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 20}, one creature within 120 feet of the Think Tank. {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Psychic damage, and the target must use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} directly toward a creature of the Think Tank's choice. If the target ends this movement within reach of the chosen creature, it must make a melee weapon attack against that creature with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

action.name: Mind Cage (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 20}, one creature the Think Tank can see within 120 feet. {@actSaveSuccess} 33 ({@damage 6d10}) Psychic damage. {@actSaveFail} 33 ({@damage 6d10}) Psychic damage, and the target perceives itself to be trapped within a nightmare conjured forth from the depths of its own psyche until it escapes. While trapped, the target has the {@condition Immobilized|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}, {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, and {@condition Deafened|XPHB} conditions. On its turn, the target can take an action to repeat the save. Each time it does, it takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage. On a success, the effect ends for it.

action.name: Unbind Gravity (1/Round)
entries: The Think Tank controls gravity in a 200-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} centered on itself until the end of the next round. Each time the Think Tank uses this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}, it decides which direction gravity pulls within the area. All creatures and objects that aren't somehow anchored to the ground in the area fall in the chosen direction until they reach the edge of the area. A creature can make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw to grab onto a fixed object it can reach, avoiding the fall on a success.

If some solid object (such as a ceiling) is encountered in this fall, falling objects and creatures strike it just as they would during a normal downward fall. If an object or creature reaches the edge of the area without striking anything, it remains there, oscillating slightly, for the duration.

Alternatively, the Think Tank can decide to prevent gravity from acting within the area. When it does, creatures within the area without a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} levitate in midair, and must move by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows them to move as if they were climbing. Unattended objects float around randomly.
If the Think Tank doesn't use this {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} during the next round, the effect ends and affected objects and creatures fall back down.

action.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Think Tank chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The Think Tank can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the dragon remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate bronze statue.

trait.name: Faultless Tracker
entries: The creatures that caused the dragon to animate become its quarries. The dragon knows the direction and distance to its quarries as long the quarries remain within Drakkenheim or until the dragon is destroyed.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dragon has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the dragon is destroyed, it reforms with all of its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} in 1 hour unless a {@spell Disintegrate|XPHB} spell is cast on its remains.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} + 9, reach 10 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) Slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Force damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

action.name: Lightning Breath
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 15}, each creature in a 60-foot long, 5-foot wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 55 ({@damage 10d10}) Lightning damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

action.name: Repulsion Breath
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 15}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} The target is pushed up to 40 feet away from the dragon.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The troll hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll hag regains 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns. If the troll hag takes Acid or Fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the hag's next turn. The troll hag dies only if it starts its turn with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll hag makes one Fungal Staff attack and one Slimeball attack. It can replace either attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Fungal Staff
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 14}, one creature within 5ft. {@actSaveFail} 16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) Psychic damage and the target has the {@condition Addled|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition (save ends).

action.name: Slimeball
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 6}, range 30/120 ft. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) Acid damage and the target has the {@condition Burning|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition ({@dice 3d10} Acid).

bonus.name: Spore Step
entries: The troll hag magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

reaction.name: Spawn Troll
entries: {@actTrigger} The troll hag takes damage. {@actResponse} Create one Fungal Trolling in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the troll hag. The fungal trolling acts immediately after the triggering creature's turn, then after the troll hag's turn on subsequent rounds.

spellcasting.name: Coven Magic
headerEntries: While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell's normal casting time, and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks).

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The troll hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

1: {@spell Scrying The hag may replace either its Fungal Staff or Slimeball attack with the following:}

trait.name: Fungal Aura
entries: The ground in a 10-foot radius of any of the three hags is difficult terrain and grants the hags half cover as it is covered in constant fungal growths and clouds of spores unless the hag has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. {@actSave con} {@dc 16}, any creature who ends its turn within the area. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Staggered|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} and {@condition Bewildered|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} conditions (save ends)

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll hag regains 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns. If the troll hag takes Acid or Fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the hag's next turn. The troll hag dies only if it starts its turn with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll hag makes one Fungal Staff attack and one Slimeball attack. It can replace either attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Fungal Staff
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 14}, one creature within 5ft. {@actSaveFail} 16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) Psychic damage and the target has the {@condition Addled|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition (save ends).

action.name: Slimeball
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 6}, range 30/120 ft. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) Acid damage and the target has the {@condition Burning|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition ({@dice 3d10} Acid).

action.name: Garden of Fungal Delights {@recharge}
entries: The coven pours their strange brew upon the mushroom patches around them, immediately spawning 7 ({@dice 2d6}) Fungal Trollings.

action.name: Rapid Growth (1/Day)
entries: If all three hags use their action to target the same fungal trolling within 60 feet of them with this ability, that trolling erupts in size and becomes a Humongous Fungus Troll. While the hags are using this ability, they must maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}. If any of the hags lose {@status Concentration|XPHB} before the third hag takes its action, the ability is not wasted but they must start over. While being targeted by Rapid Growth, the targeted fungal trolling has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Vexing Curse
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} 19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) Psychic damage and the target has the {@condition Jinxed|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} ({@dice 1d6}) condition (save ends).

trait.name: Absorbing Flesh
entries: A creature reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by the growth is absorbed into its body and dies. When it absorbs a creature, the growth's size increases by one category. If the growth finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} and hasn't absorbed a body since its last {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, its size decreases by one category.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The growth makes a number of attacks based on its size: two (Medium), three (Large), four (Huge) or five (Gargantuan).

action.name: Assimilating Pseudopod
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 10 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) Necrotic damage, and if the target is smaller than the growth, it is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave dex} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} The target is swallowed by the growth. A swallowed creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions, has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} from attacks and effects outside the growth, and takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Necrotic damage and the start of each of the growth's turns. The growth regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the amount of Necrotic damage dealt, and excess healing increases its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Maximum.

If the growth takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the growth must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which land with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition in unoccupied spaces within 10 feet of the growth. If the growth dies, a swallowed creature no longer has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and can escape from the corpse using 20 feet of movement, exiting with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

reaction.name: Adaptable Flesh
entries: {@actTrigger} The growth takes damage from a spell or attack. {@actResponse} The growth halves the damage it takes from the triggering spell or attack.

trait.name: Displacement
entries: The polyp's form is constantly shifting and moving through reality in unnatural ways. Attack rolls against the polyp have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}. If the polyp takes damage, this trait ceases to function until the start of its next turn. This trait is suppressed while the polyp has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} or {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions or is otherwise unable to move.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The polyp makes two Mucus attacks.

action.name: Mucus
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) Acid damage, and a 5-foot radius centered on the target is covered in acidic slime for 1 minute. A creature other than the polyp that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave con} {@dc 15}. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Acid damage, and the target has the {@condition Burning|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition ({@dice 3d6} Acid).

action.name: Slip Space
entries: The polyp teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 20 feet. {@actSave con} {@dc 15}, each creature in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the polyp when it reappears. {@actSaveFail} 16 ({@damage 3d10}) Force damage. Failure by 5 or More: The target triggers an {@table Arcane Anomalies|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} centered on itself. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

bonus.name: Shift Step
entries: The polyp teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet.

reaction.name: Confused Realities
entries: {@actTrigger} The polyp takes damage from a creature it can see within 30 feet. {@actResponse} The triggering creature is teleported to an unoccupied space the polyp can see within 30 feet of its original space. The destination must be on a surface or liquid that can support the target without the target having to squeeze.

trait.name: From Another World
entries: The void pirate doesn't have the standard Aberrant Traits other creatures in the Space Between Worlds have.

trait.name: Keen Eye, Sharp Wit
entries: The void pirate has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The void pirate makes three attacks.

action.name: Void Longsword
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 5 ft. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) Force damage.

action.name: Pirate Pistol
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 9}, range 30/120 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) Piercing damage.

bonus.name: Bark Orders
entries: One void pirate squib or quartermaster within 60 feet of the void pirate can use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} or make an attack.

reaction.name: Captain's Command (2/Day)
entries: {@actTrigger} A {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} creature within 30 feet of the void pirate fails an attack roll. {@actResponse} If the creature can hear the void pirate, it can reroll the attack roll and use the higher result.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The void pirate casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to spell attacks):

trait.name: From Another World
entries: The void pirate doesn't have the standard Aberrant Traits other creatures in the Space Between Worlds have.

trait.name: Magical Chaos
entries: When the void pirate or a creature within 30 feet of it is targeted by a spell, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 4-5, an {@table Arcane Anomalies|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} triggers on the caster. On a 6, the spell fails and an {@table Arcane Anomalies|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} triggers on the caster.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The void pirate makes three Void Blast attacks.

action.name: Void Blast
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) Force damage, and the target is knocked 10 feet away from the void pirate.

bonus.name: Summon Elemental (1/Day)
entries: The void pirate magically summons an {@creature Entropic Flame|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}, {@creature Walking Geode|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}, {@creature Living Deep Haze|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}, or {@creature Animated Delerium Sludge|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the void pirate, whom it obeys. It takes its turn immediately after the void pirate. It lasts for 1 hour, until it or the void pirate dies, or the void pirate dismisses it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

trait.name: Captain's Orders
entries: While within 60 feet of a void pirate captain, the void pirate has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

trait.name: Duel to the Death
entries: Once per turn, if the Void Pirate is within 5 feet of an enemy, and no other creatures are within 5 feet of them, the void pirate can deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Slashing damage with their Voidblade attack.

trait.name: From Another World
entries: The void pirate doesn't have the standard Aberrant Traits other creatures in the Space Between Worlds have.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The void pirate makes two attacks.

action.name: Voidblade
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) Force damage.

action.name: Boltgun
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 6}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) Piercing damage, and the target has the {@condition Slowed|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Bark Orders
entries: One void pirate squib within 60 feet of the void pirate can use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} or make an attack.

trait.name: Captain's Orders
entries: While within 60 feet of a void pirate captain, the void pirate has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

trait.name: From Another World
entries: The void pirate doesn't have the standard Aberrant Traits other creatures in the Space Between Worlds have.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The void pirate makes two Void Cutlass attacks or uses its Sturdy Net.

action.name: Void Cutlass
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Sturdy Net
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. or range 15/30 ft. {@h}The target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} and {@condition Defenseless|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} conditions. A creature can take an action to free itself or another creature in a net with a successful {@dc 14} Strength check. Dealing 10 Slashing damage to the net (AC 12) frees the target without harming it and destroys the net.

bonus.name: Man the Cannons
entries: The void pirate loads an artillery weapon, such as a cannon or ballista.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: The elemental explodes when it dies and it hasn't taking Force, Radiant, or Thunder damage since its last turn. {@actSave con} {@dc 16}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the elemental. {@actSaveFail} 42 ({@damage 12d6}) Necrotic damage, and the target gains one {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The explosion triggers a random {@table Arcane Anomalies|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} (see Appendix C).

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two Shard Slam attacks.

action.name: Shard Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 10 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage. {@actSave con} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage, and the target gains one {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the gargoyle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

trait.name: Faultless Tracker
entries: The creature that caused the gargoyle to animate becomes its quarry. The gargoyle knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long the quarry remains within Drakkenheim or until the gargoyle is destroyed.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the wall gargoyle is destroyed, it reforms with all of its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} in 1 hour unless a {@spell Disintegrate|XPHB} spell is cast on its remains.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gargoyle makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ratling casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The ratling has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Balefire
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) Necrotic damage, and the target has the {@condition Burning|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition ({@dice 2d8} Necrotic).

action.name: Conjure Swarms (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The ratling conjures two Swarms of Rats, which appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet. The swarms act immediately after the ratling in {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}. The swarms remain for 1 minute or until destroyed.

bonus.name: Teleport
entries: The ratling teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
entries: The warp marauder is immune to {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} and has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against contaminated spells. The warp marauder may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} levels.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
entries: As an action, the warp marauder can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 ({@dice 3d6}) {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Once the warp marauder has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Alien Intellect
entries: The warp marauder is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks made to ascertain the warp marauder's intentions or sincerity have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

trait.name: Extraplanar Gullet
entries: The warp marauder's back opens into a large mouth that leads to an extradimensional gullet. Anything it swallows is transported into this extraplanar space, which manifests as a rhizomatic network of slurping tunnels and fleshy passages. This space can hold any number of creatures of any size, and nothing inside the space can harm the warp marauder.

A creature within the gullet can take an action to attempt to escape, making a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a success, it reappears in the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of the warp marauder. On a failure, it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Psychic damage. If the warp marauder dies, everything inside the extraplanar gullet appears in the nearest unoccupied spaces to its corpse.

trait.name: Grasping Tentacles
entries: The warp marauder can have up to four tentacles at a time. Each tentacle has AC 20, 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage. Destroying a tentacle deals no damage to the warp marauder, which can extrude a replacement tentacle on its next turn. A creature within 5 feet can take an action to break a tentacle with a successful {@dc 15} Strength check.

trait.name: Swirling Color Field
entries: A field of shimmering color reverberates around the warp marauder, distorting reality. A creature that hits the warp marauder with an attack suffers one of the following effects, determined randomly (roll {@dice 1d6}). A creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} and adjacent to the warp marauder isn't affected by the Swirling Color Field.

trait.name: 1-2: Blue
entries: The attacker is teleported to an unoccupied space the warp marauder can see within 20 feet. The chosen space must be on a surface or in a liquid that can support the target. The attacker is then subjected to the following effect. {@actSave cha} {@dc 15}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Immobilized|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition (save ends).

trait.name: 3-4: Yellow
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 15}. {@actSaveFail} 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Lightning damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

trait.name: 5-6: Red

While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and saving throws, and the warp marauder can't use this tentacle against another target.

languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The warp witch can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Balefire Lantern
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) Cold damage, and the target has the {@condition Slowed|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} condition until the end of the warp witch's next turn.

action.name: Psychic Scream
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 13}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition (save ends).

action.name: Possession
entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 13}, one Humanoid the warp witch can see within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target is possessed by the Warp Witch. The witch disappears, and the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition and loses control of its body. The witch controls the target's body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The witch can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead. The witch retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions. It otherwise uses the possessed target's game statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the witch ends it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or the witch is turned or forced out by an effect like the {@spell Dispel Evil and Good|XPHB} spell. When the possession ends, the witch reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. If the target succeeds on its save or the effect ends for it, it is immune to this warp witch's {@variantrule Possession|XPHB} for 24 hours.

trait.name: Special Immunities

trait.name: Fully Contaminated

trait.name: Delerium Healing
entries: As an action, the dragon can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 ({@dice 3d6}) {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Once the dragon has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Alien Intellect

trait.name: Haze Aura

action.name: The dragon always takes its turn on Initiative count 20

However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the dragon takes one of the following {@variantrule Epic Action|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Epic Actions} at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Tail

action.name: Octarine Breath {@recharge 5}

action.name: Dimension Hop (1/Round)

action.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The dragon chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The dragon can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

If the vampire takes Radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the traits described in the "Vampire Weaknesses" sidebar in the Monsters of Drakkenheim.

action.name: Claws

action.name: Bite
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 16}, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, or {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveFail} 15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) Necrotic damage. The target's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to that amount.

bonus.name: Morrigan's Fury (1/Short Rest)
entries: The vampire howls at the moon, gaining {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage except Acid and Radiant damage for 1 minute or until it has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. As part of this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, the vampire moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} toward a {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} creature without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} action.

The grim-faced doctor's jaw tightens as they lower their browand sigh. Suddenly, their face contorts into a wicked, impossiblegrimace, a smile stretched too wide for the muscles on their face.Fiendish light glimmers in their eyes as hornlike bulges rip throughthe flesh of their forehead. Profane runes suddenly blaze upontheir flesh, releasing the smell of burning meat and sulfur. Thebody rises into the air, the muscle spasms barely containing the evilspirit bound within this mortal host. A spiral of flame encircles theapothecary's body as they unleash a horrific scream, speaking in avoice which is not their own. "Now, you will die, mortal."

A Soulbound Host is the physical body of an apothecary who has willingly allowed an extraplanar creature to possess them, trapping the powerful outsider in a mortal form. Powerful yet vulnerable, Soulbound Hosts loathe their creators. They wander the world for the means to reverse the curse of mortality placed upon them and return to their otherworldly domains.

Exorcist and Alienist apothecaries do not primarily study the body, and rarely practice the type of magic and science which leads to mutant horrors and flesh-stitched abominations. They are instead concerned with the supernatural forces of the mind and soul. Many research and contact powerful extraplanar entities, eager to possess mortals as a means of entering the material world. These apothecaries learn how to create Soulbound Hosts as a powerful means to contain and fight back against these dangerous otherworldly foes.

entries.name: Desperate Gambit
entries: A Soulbound Host is usually created under truly desperate circumstances, such as when a heroic apothecary faces a dangerous otherworldly being such as a demon, fey, spirit, or inscrutable entity from the Space Between Worlds. Not only are these planar invaders pernicious foes, many are effectively immortal—often these creatures simply reform when killed outside their native planes. Thus, an apothecary who lacks the ability to defeat the demon on their own, or who wishes to defeat a powerful outsider in a more permanent fashion, may instead decide upon a heroic act of self-sacrifice by turning themselves into a Soulbound Host.

entries.name: Preparing the Trap
entries: Using an array of implanted metals, ingested tinctures, mental preparations, and occult incantations, a skilled apothecary may willingly prepare their body for possession. During the process, the apothecary can weave a unique spiritual trap. It then falls to the apothecary to convince the otherworldly creature to possess them, an act that many outsiders are eager to do. Thus, the canny apothecary preys on the ego of the monster itself.

entries.name: Mortal Curse
entries: When the outsider inhabits the body, the apothecary's soul departs, leaving the extraplanar creature to take their place spiritually. If this mortal form is killed or destroyed, the bound creature does not simply return to their plane of origin. Instead, the spirit departs to the afterworlds like any other mortal soul, losing their accumulated otherworldly power forever. Thus, the Soulbound Host becomes both a prison and a death sentence for the other wielding being tricked into the apothecary's body.

entries.name: Rogue Hosts
entries: Unfortunately, this act of self-sacrifice is not without its imperfections. The apothecary's body is filled with otherworldly essence, and while the creature's power is greatly diminished, they often remain extremely dangerous—allies of the departed apothecary may still find it challenging to slay the Soulbound Host. Many escape, wandering the world with stolen lives and even assuming the identity of their host while they search for the means to escape their now mortal form. All bound outsiders are painfully aware of their new mortality, frustrated that returning to their planes of origin is not a simple matter of destroying their flesh-cage or switching their essence into a different host, one which lacks the binding wards placed by the apothecary.

entries.name: Price of Freedom
entries: Trapped outsiders can win their freedom by calling back the soul of the apothecary who trapped them, and resurrecting them into their body. This is a thing many outsiders are loathe to do out of fiendish ego, since it puts the original soul in a bargaining position. In this way, the apothecary can force the spirit to accept a bargain which requires them to remain in their own worlds for at least the duration of the apothecary's lifetime.

entries.name: Study the Foe
entries: Characters proficient in {@skill Religion|XPHB}, {@skill Medicine|XPHB}, or {@skill Survival|XPHB} gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) or Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) checks to Study a Soulbound Host, learning the following based on the result:

entries.name: (10+) Possessed Body
entries: You know the Soulbound Host's type and damage {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistances}.

entries.name: (15+) Extraplanar Magic
entries: Depending on the type of spirit, you learn either the Hellfire Chain, Illusory Assault, or Psychic Barrage actions, as well as the Spellcasting trait of the host.

entries.name: (20+) Cursed Fate
entries: You recognize its desperation caused by its spirit-bound mortality and its Reactions.

entries.name: Combat Tactics
entries: A Soulbound Host is a careful combatant. Though powerful, the last thing they want is to be killed in their mortal form. If they are seriously injured, they often attempt to bargain, offering power and knowledge to assailants who spare them.

items.name: Academy Apprentice

entries: Dressed in simple purple robes with the symbol of the Amethyst Academy upon their left breast, the apprentice carries a spellbook fastened to their belt, and a simple satchel of alchemical ingredients.

These mages-in-training have completed enough study to cast level 1 arcane spells. The Amethyst Academy often assigns apprentices to higher-ranked mages, where they assist with research, experimentation, and fieldwork. One or more apprentices often accompany a Master Mage.

items.name: Academy Grandmaster

entries: The Academy Grandmaster wears a purple and gold jacket and trousers, with an Academy's insignia broach on their lapel and glimmering rings on each finger. They carry an ornate gold and black staff topped with a glimmering {@item crystal|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|delerium crystal}. Their eyes crackle with energy, harnessing the raw power around them.

These are powerful spellcasters who can cast level 9 spells. They lead the Amethyst Academy's most important projects and can access almost every resource available within. Only a handful exist: beyond the eight members of the Academy Directorate, there are no more than twenty alive today. In the rare event of a vacancy, the Master Mages may nominate Grandmasters for consideration. Since the Directorate must unanimously choose one to join them, openings can take decades to fill.

entries.name: Combat Tactics
entries: Their first action is to cast {@spell Time Stop|XPHB}, followed by {@spell Wall of Force} to trap as many foes as possible. Those who aren't entrapped are blasted with {@spell Prismatic Spray}, {@spell Chain Lightning}, and {@spell Fireball}.
They flee using {@spell Teleport} when {@status Bloodied|XPHB}.

items.name: Academy Mage

entries: Dressed in a purple long jacket with gold trim, dark trousers and simple black boots, the mage carries a wand in one hand and a book in the other, with the symbol of the Amethyst Academy emblazoned upon the back of their jacket in gold.

These rank-and-file members of the Amethyst Academy can cast spells of up to level 3 or 4. Apprentices qualify for this rank when they can cast at least level 2 spells. Most Academy mages conduct research or craft magic items for the Amethyst Academy, and a handful join survey teams exploring ancient sites or the ruins of Drakkenheim. Others are assigned as court mages for low-ranking nobility. The majority of Academy mages never attain a higher rank than this one.

items.name: Academy Outcast

entries: Dressed in a simple brown trench coat, with black trousers and boots and a simple white shirt, the Academy Outcast sports a pair of welding goggles upon their unkempt hair. With a sly expression upon their face, they hold their wands at the ready.

Not all mageborn are cut out for the rules, regulations, and intense study and practice required by the Amethyst Academy, and some do not make it through their schooling. An outcast may still be under the guidance of the Academy, performing field work or odd jobs that require a more hands-on approach. Oftentimes these outcasts dabble in dangerous magics, and have far less caution, and far too much confidence for the Academy's liking
One of the strongest was an academy outcast. For those who are expelled, what's the worst that can happen?

items.name: Adult Delerium Dragon
entries: A fully mature Delerium Dragon establishes its own domain within the Space Between Worlds, finding a place suitable to its temperament. There it seeks to understand itself and the world around it.

monsterFluff.name: Agog

entries: This horrific thing has no shape or body resembling anything from the Mortal World. It roughly resembles a tree stump with four root-like legs each ending in a misshapen hoof. It has a wet, mottled, bark-like hide, and sprouting from the side of it like branches are knobbly arms ending in sharp claws. The top of its body is a gaping, tooth-filled mouth. It is shoveling chunks of horse-flesh into itself, and giggling as it swallows the ripped flesh. Whatever passes for arms, on the inside of the palm are yellow eyes.

The Agog resembles what mortals might comprehend as a tree stump, and when the creature is motionless, it may even be passed by. However, when it springs to life its true form is something wholly bizarre. These creatures waddle along desert landscapes in the Space Between Worlds, or rest in the muck surrounding the screaming heads. They feed on corpses and have a seemingly endless appetite and a need to satiate it.

entries.name: Study the Foe
entries: Characters proficient in {@skill History|XPHB} or {@skill Nature|XPHB} gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}) checks when they take the {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine an Agog, learning the following based on the result.

entries.name: Combat Tactics
entries: The Agog barrels towards its enemies, flailing its arms towards them and attempting to grab them and toss them to the ground. If it knocks a creature down, it will immediately begin attempting to devour them.

I don't know if I want these guys poking around in my head! That's where I keep my thoughts!

Hovering inches from the ground, lab coat billowing in an unknown breeze that seems to swirl around the figure, the Alienist mutters under their breath, eyes glowing white as they pull on the threads of your mind. You feel the imminent threat of your psyche shattering to this apothecary's will with little more than a flick of their wrist.

An Alienist seeks to master the mysteries of the mind. Having devoted years to studying the inner workings of the brain to unlock its latent potential, an Alienist is able to bend reality, read thoughts, and manipulate the thoughts of others. They tap into unfathomable realities and shift the world to their will using the psychic energies they call upon from eldritch lore and arcane knowledge.

entries.name: Alienist Minions
entries: Alienists keep several experiments of their own on hand. They have been known to keep {@creature Wretched Patient|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Wretched Patients}, their minds melted by the Alienist's inhuman experimentation, turning them into obedient and loyal servants. {@creature Disembodied Psyche|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Disembodied Psyches} and {@creature Cerebrograft|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Cerebrografts} are a few of their higher-end creations, having removed the brain of a creature and given it a unique and bespoke form of sentience, these creatures serve as guards to an Alienist's work, or minions capable of complex thought and aid.

items: {@b Personality Trait:} I can't help but analyze every person who comes before me. I want to know what they think, and why they are the way they are.
{@b Bond:} I study the mind for scientific advancement. How easily this muscle can be manipulated, altered, and used in unforeseen ways is fascinating research that must be explored.
{@b Ideal:} I am the only one capable of this level of advanced mental research, someone else would have gotten it wrong
{@b Flaw:} My unbound intellect means that I can never be fooled, tricked, or manipulated, and thus I can never be outsmarted, to think I could is laughable.

entries.name: Combat Tactics
entries: Wretched Patients are simple minions. They defend themselves and reluctantly fight at the command of their creator. If their creator dies, Wretched Patients flee or cower.
His mouth isn't moving but I can hear everything he's saying, I guess it's time to silence the voices.

monsterFluff.name: Allopine

entries: This creature has a gaunt and misshapen form, with the scaled body, tail, and head of an alligator, bony spikes covering its body like a porcupine, batlike wings, and long, spindly limbs.

The Allopine is a creature that defies logic, seemingly a shifting and confused array of various animals—its disjointed and bizarre arrangements make them a puzzle to look at. Flying through the Space Between Worlds, the creatures travel in swarms occupying the dark caverns and ruins found throughout the non-places. When making their way into the Mortal World, they will find old barns or caves to hide in.

monsterFluff.name: Amalgamation

entries: Before the throne is a gibbering amalgamation of fleshy tumors, rotting bones, and rancid layers of bloated fat suspended between the ceiling and floor by stalky strands of gnarled tissue. A palpable aura of contamination emanates from the beast. The mass is covered in bursting sores and shuddering mucus nodule that weep bile and delerium sludge. The creature mutters in alien tongues from six yawning mouths, piping and sputtering in discordant musical tones, and lazily shifting eyes of massive size open and close throughout its bulk. Thick trunk-like tentacles reach out from its hideous stinking form to squirm and writhe around the chamber. Several appendages are wrapped around pulsing human organs: lungs, liver, kidney, a heart, a brain, and dangling amongst them is the jeweled Crown of Westemr.
Dwelling within the throne room of Castle Drakken is the Amalgamation, the result of a cascading catastrophe of contamination and mutation.

When the meteor struck, several magical occurrences happened almost instantaneously throughout the city. The Fracturing of the Inscrutable Tower triggered haywire {@table Arcane Anomalies|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Arcane Anomaly} through the city, while the impact of the meteor sent a shockwave of magical devastation that shattered glass, blew through stone and wood, and reduced most living creatures to ash. Others caught in the blast were instantly transformed into monsters, and buildings and streets were shifted into sentient growths and misshapen horrors.

Castle Drakken was an epicenter of magical wards, protective spells, divination, and all manner of inherently magical trinkets and artifacts. The throne room where King Ulrich sat housed several of the most powerful magical relics in Westemr. The Crown of Westemr being the most prominent, although King Ulrich himself held a magical scepter, wore four magical rings, and a possessed a protective amulet. Furthermore, the large circular stained glass window behind the throne was imbued with magic that allowed it to change colors and depict different images throughout the seasons.

Naturally, when the rippling wave of arcane destruction blasted through the throne room, it fractured the abundant magical energies within the room, immediately opening a rift to the Space Between Worlds (see chapter 8) and amalgamating all the king's men into a massive mound of rippling fatty flesh. King Ulrich tried to escape but the magical mayhem fused him to his throne. As the King melted, he was absorbed by the expanding flesh, his face coming to rest as a disfigured grimace placed in the center of the horrible Amalgamation.

The creature continued to grow as the years passed, and those who went searching for the lost king would soon become one with the Amalgamation as well. Tendrils of strange flesh now spread like a web of sinew and skin across the throne room while pulsing contamination ripples out of the grotesque mass. A massive maw spans the length of the creature with various human bones posing as jagged and sharp teeth. Its tongue is a writhing mass of intestines and gore. No longer can any semblance of those lost to the Amalgamation be found. The king's face still prominently sits above the creature's massive maw, a mocking display of the fragility of the empires of a world not ready to face horrors beyond their comprehension.

The Amalgamation has a multidimensional form that straddles the Material Plane and the Space Between Worlds. Its mere presence acts as an anchor for the dimensional rift that pulls more and more contamination into Drakkenheim.

entries.name: Study the Foe
entries: Characters who have one or more mutations, or who are afflicted with any form of madness gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}) checks when they {@action Study|XPHB} the Amalgamation, learning the following based on the result:

entries.name: (20+) Multidimensional
entries: You recognize its {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immunities}, and its Rejuvenation, Malignancy, and Immutable Form traits.

entries.name: (25+) Insatiable Hunger
entries: You know of the creature's Bite attack, as well as its Mind-Breaking Whispers ability.

entries.name: (30+) Beyond Comprehension
entries: You are aware of its strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

entries.name: Combat Tactics
entries: The Amalgamation is a formidable foe capable of grappling multiple targets and eating them or throwing them around the battlefield. It constantly summons {@creature Pyknic Maunder|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Pyknic Maunders} as additional support while it uses Mind-Breaking Whispers to shatter the minds of its greatest threats.
The Amalgamation does not fear any mortal creature, believing itself indestructible to mortal means. It does not flee or cower.

entries.name: Amethyst Academy
entries: The wizards of the Amethyst Academy perform all sorts of arcane tasks throughout the nations. They study ancient ruins, maintain their magical strongholds, accompany nobles on errands, or participate as members of their council. These mages are well known throughout the continent and are identifiable by their purple-robes and academy rings.

entries.name: Academy Combat Tactics
entries: Broadly speaking, Amethyst Academy mages eschew combat, valuing their own lives too highly to take such risks. They view themselves as researchers, craftspeople, and scholars, not war mages—few bother learning damaging spells beyond simple cantrips, instead focusing on practical magic for their academic and industrial pursuits. Nevertheless, they know that magic is still a dangerous vocation, and ready themselves to flee perilous situations with {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} spells or teleportation magic.

When violent confrontation seem inevitable, Amethyst Academy agents often hire mercenaries or adventurers, or dispatch summoned creatures in their stead. Nevertheless, there are bold explorers who take to field research and prepare themselves for dangerous expeditions—particularly, those who personnally study the ruins of Drakkenheim. They often utilize constructs such as Shield Guardians or summoned elementals bound to service with {@spell Planar Binding}. Mages usually begin combat with defensive or control spells as befits the situation, such as taking to the air with {@spell Fly} or subduing foes with {@spell Slow}. Only once they are certain the situation is under control will they use their signature Prismatic Blasts or area-of-effect spells like {@spell Fireball} and {@spell Lightning Bolt}. These mages almost always flee once they've become {@status Bloodied|XPHB}, viewing a temporary setback or mission failure as a preferable outcome over their deaths.

items.name: Ancient Delerium Dragon
entries: Perhaps older than the cosmos itself, Ancient Delerium Dragons possess knowledge and memories of worlds and eons which have past, many more which never were, and countless which cannot be. Their very presence warps the world around them according to their whims.

monsterFluff.name: Animated Delerium Sludge

entries: A mound of iridescently streaked black muck lumbers through the ruins, splashing with each ponderous step. The sludge reshapes into a towering, almost human-like form, with slimy arms and thick unsteady legs. A head bubbles atop its viscous body revealing a slime drooling maw and two hollows for eyes. Yet, it carries a strangely mirthful expression, as if finding joy in its grotesque existence. The mound emits a gravelly roar, full of sinister glee, and barrels towards you, undeterred by the debris in its way.
These Contaminated Water Elementals are often found in the cisterns, sewers, and other aquatic locations of Drakkenheim.

entries.name: Study the Foe

entries.name: (20+) Easy to Outwit
entries: You know the elemental's mental ability scores and saving throws.

entries.name: Combat Tactics
entries: Animated Delerium Sludge often lies dormant in bodies of water before attempting to Engulf an unsuspecting creature. If reduced to less than 20 Hit Points, it attempts to slip back into the nearby sludge and Hide, hoping to be left alone.

monsterFluff.name: Anomollusk

entries: A colossal snail as wide as a city street with a shell the size of a small house glides slowly into view. Its shell has a kaleidoscopic fractal shimmer, projecting hues of unknown colors that swirl in incomprehensible patterns. As it moves, its shell seems to refract light in ways that seem nonsensical or wrong. You must strain your eyes to look at it wriggle towards you. Its bulbous head ends in two long antennae each holding a small octarine eye. Slimy mucus drips off its flesh, leaving sizzling trails and corroding anything it touches.

When a simple snail latches onto a delerium shard, there is a slight chance it fuses with its shell. These humble creatures can grow to massive proportions if they survive the contamination. Over time, the shells merge with more delerium, mutating the snails into chaotic conduits for erratic magic called an Anomollusk.

Its defensive crystalline shells can also absorb arcane energy. This adaptation disrupts nearby magic, rendering spells and magical weapons unreliable. Attacking an Anomollusk with magic is dangerous, causing wild magic flares and {@table Arcane Anomalies|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Arcane Anomaly}, giving the creature its name. Driven to consume contaminated flora, Anomollusks inadvertently collect magical energy, making them especially valuable for creating magic items.

Anomollusks are predominantly found in areas like Queen's Park Garden, where the flora is richly imbued with magic. Though sometimes seen in the city's outskirts, they prefer heavily contaminated areas such as around the Crater's Edge. These creatures absorb and occasionally release magical energy from the environment, unleashing sporadic bursts of chaotic magic in the landscape.

In their wake, Anomollusks leave trails of acidic decay—ichors far too toxic even for their bodies to contain for long. Moving with lackadaisical whimsy, they etch eerie patterns into stone and metal, occasionally resembling arcane runes when observed from above. If there is any meaning or purpose behind these markings, none can say for certain.

entries.name: Study the Foe
entries: Characters proficient in {@skill Animal Handling|XPHB} or {@skill Survival|XPHB} gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}) checks to {@action Study|XPHB} an Anomollusk, learning the following based on the result:

entries.name: (15+) Dangerous Slime

entries.name: (20+) Slow and Simple Minded
entries: You recognize its strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

entries.name: Combat Tactics
entries: Drawn to magic, Anomollusk's view spellcasters and those equipped with magic items as delicious morsels. It attacks by first using its Creep action before it tries to Slobber on them. If threatened, it tries to cover the enemy and its territory in acidic slime. If reduced to less than half Hit Points, it attempts to flee.

A perfect physical form of humanity stands before you, its flawlessly formed and muscle-bound flesh is tinted in a golden hue while its veins bulge and glow with octarine light. Their eyes emit cascades of light and their voice is a booming chorus. As swirls of fire, ice, and electricity crackle around them, they pulse with unbound energy.

entries.name: Perfect Transmogrification
entries: Amongst {@creature Mutagenist|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Mutagenists}, the quest for genetic perfection can become an all-consuming obsession. Those who seek to achieve this so-called superior state refer to it as the "Apex" and describe the transformation as creating the ultimate humanoid specimen.

Through years of study and trials, Mutagenists have perfected their Transmogrifying Elixir to harness the ultimate power of mortal potential. This formula allows them to amplify their natural capabilities to the peak physical form while maintaining their unbound intellect. There is no telling how many long years a Mutagenist has spent in their lab, and how many unwilling test subjects had to suffer the fates of their imperfect formulae before they arrived at the ultimate conclusion of their research. This is the pinnacle of their scientific study, the perfected Transmogrifying Elixir: the Apex Formula.

entries.name: Permanent Transformation
entries: The process renders the Mutagenist permanently altered. Energy courses through their veins, their strength and agility extended to the very limits of human capabilities. Their form is able to shift and adapt to incoming threats, and they are able to perceive events around them with great precision. Their mind, although it remains intellectually intact by the process, is inherently and irrevocably shattered. No Mutagenist who takes the Apex Formula could ever perceive or admit to the fracturing of their mind. Regardless of their vast intelligence, a sickening madness takes hold of their psyche; one that plunges the apothecary-turned-Apex creature into a hostile, madness-filled rage. They still hold onto the threads of their vast scientific mind, using that as a justification for their actions, unaware of the deranged mental state they now reside within.

entries.name: The Folly of Perfection
entries: Even Mutagenists who achieve the Apex state have a gnawing question in the back of their minds: is it truly enough? Could they become even more? Their seemingly perfect form is not without subtle flaws, broken psyche, and weaknesses. Many Mutagenists can never truly be satisfied with their results, and even the Apex Formula can never fulfill the unattainable desire for absolute perfection. It is this obsession that has led many Mutagenists to lunacy in the face of their achievements. For even an Apex may spend eternity bound to their workshop, kidnapping unwilling subjects to continue to test and experiment, seeking a perfection that will never truly be achieved.

entries.name: Roleplaying Traits
entries: The following traits can be used to inspire roleplaying the Cacophonous Chimera:

items: {@b Personality Trait:} I am humanity perfected! All beings are beneath me, for I am the apex of physical existence. All should cower in my glory
{@b Bond:} Science has granted us this gift! This research is the most valuable scientific discovery in the world and must be protected!
{@b Ideal:} Do not try and stop me, for I am offering perfection to all of humanity. Can't you see? The Apex Form will cure the world of all sickness, all flaws, all weakness!
{@b Flaw:} There cannot be a weakness in my design. If there is, I will solve it — I just need more time!

entries.name: Study the Foe
entries: Characters proficient in {@skill Medicine|XPHB}, {@skill Survival|XPHB}, or {@skill Arcana|XPHB} gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) or Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) checks to {@action Study|XPHB} the Apex. , learning the following based on the result:

entries.name: (15+) Adapts to Threats
entries: You recognize the Apex's Rapid Adaptation {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and Regeneration trait.

entries.name: (20+) Harness the Elements
entries: You are aware of its {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} attacks.

entries.name: (25+) Perfect Form but Fragile Mind
entries: You know the Apex's weakness to Necrotic and Psychic damage.

entries.name: Combat Tactics
entries: The Apex will often be accompanied by several abominations of its own creation. Lab assistants, failed experiments, and {@creature Wretched Patient|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|Wretched Patients} are often by its side.

An Apex begins combat by unleashing one of its {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} attacks. It quickly analyzes the battlefield, looking for the most optimal use of its energy. It observes the arrangement of its enemies and decides if it is best to use its lightning, fire, or cold attack based on what will deliver the most damage to the most targets.
It then uses its speed to move close to a target to smash it with its Slam attacks. The Apex prefers to target Frozen enemies with its Slams.

The Apex is unwilling to see its own flaws, but it is not stupid. If reduced below 60 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it unleashes a final attack and attempts to distance itself from its enemies, hoping to escape and recuperate.

monsterFluff.name: Arcane Wraith

entries: Tattered purple robes hang off the ethereal skeleton drifting silently through the air. Its rune-inscribed skull menacingly chants arcane words as points of octarine light flare from the dark holes of its eyes. Ghostly tendrils flicker and five Academy rings jangle as it raises a skeletal hand, enacting the arcane gestures of its first spell.

An Arcane Wraith is the disembodied, corrupt, undead spirit of an arcane spellcaster who perished violently in Drakkenheim. Delerium affects people with magical skill in unpredictable ways. In their death throes, those with mageborn blood may transform into vile undead, eternally bound to the Haze while retaining a portion of their arcane power twisted into malevolent, shadowy forms. Arcane Wraiths relentlessly hunger for both magical essence and life force. They are particularly aggressive towards living spellcasters, but readily attack anyone carrying magic items, spell components, or {@item crystal|MonstersOfDrakkenheim|delerium crystals}.

These wraiths are most frequently seen near highly magical areas, like the Inscrutable Tower, however, they have been spotted elsewhere in the Inner City, and rarely, outside the city walls. Places like potion shops and a mage's former residence are also common haunts for an Arcane Wraith.

Left alone, these spirits ponderously study arcane phenomena, often drawing paradoxical conclusions. They collect scrolls, and spellbooks while scribbling rambling notes. Occasionally, their mad research may uncover a genuine revelation, but discerning discovery from delusion amidst their tattered scrawlings is difficult. A careful approach may allow one to converse with these undead. However, their speech is a convoluted mixture of half-remembered incantations, loquacious postulations, and incoherent babbling. They quickly grow frustrated when interlocutors fail to grasp the brilliance of their work.
